activities.loc: Branch 1, Calumet County Courthouse, West Entrance

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joaquin NMI Luna-Pucheta

records.addlTxt:
948.025(1)(d) - Repeated sexual assault of same child

Shall not have contact with victim, C.L.S. (d/o/b 03/19/2011) or M.I.S. (d/o/b 07/26/1981), their residences or their immediate family members.  No contact means no contact in person, in writing, by phone, computer, through a third person or otherwise, except through the defendant's attorney.
Shall not have contact with Chilton Middle School.
No unsupervised contact with anyone under age 18, must be supervised by parent or guardian.
Shall not apply for a passport while case is pending.

Public defender eligible, 
Defendant advised of charge and penalties, 
$7,500 Cash bond ordered
